p:
Currently, Arctic sea ice is an ecological barrier for migratory birds. Henningsson and Alerstam
27 also rated transarctic migration as particularly difficult for birds because of navigational issues (but see
28, 29 ) and of the lack of stop-over sites. With sea ice constraining the availability of stop-over sites, more costly and risky non-stop transarctic flights are therefore unlikely. Conversely, migration along sea ice edges at the periphery of the Arctic Basin seems much more widespread
28 . Also, radar studies and direct observations demonstrated that several species of seabirds are capable of crossing the Arctic Basin
30, 31 as already observed in fishes
32 and marine mammals
31 .
